CatDescriptText: Mr. Charles Greenlee, clerk, Peoples Natural Gas Co., 810 Bryn Mawr Road, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, April 25, 1959, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think those receiving Mother's Assistance should be required to report to the proper authorities just how all of the grant is spent, or should the present latitude in spending it be permitted to continue?" answer reads: "Offhand, I think that it should be as it is. That is except in cases where the mothers openly are neglecting their children.  The case worker should know whether or not the mother is pending the money in the right way."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Charles Greenlee wearing houndstooth suit jacket, standing on corner of Fifth and Liberty Avenues, with Kappels in background, Downtown
